body.p:
His Excellency Gov
Thos E Bramlette,
Sir,

At the present December Term 1864, David Whitehouse -- was convicted under two indictments -- for selling liquor to two minors -- one John Cure -- the other C. Sandford -- On the trial of Cure -- defendant produced and served by the Father of John Cure -- that in the year 1862 -- he had given Dr Whitehouse a written authority to sell his sons Ferdinand and John whatever they wanted. Whitehouse kept a Tavern and would not permit the boys to drink liquor without the order -- which the father gave -- The Judge construed the law that there must be written authority for every sale -- that a general authority would not shield the defendant and therefore he was fined -- and immediately repleived the debt --

Precisely the same state of facts extended as to C. Sandford under the same circumstances he was fined $50 -- in each case -- the undersigned John F. Fisk defendant -- and the undersigned J. R Hallam prosecuted as Commonwealth ProTem -- We think this a fair case for Executive Clemency -- Evidently the Sandford and both the parents did what they thought was a compliance with the law
I make no recommendation but the facts are correctly set out in the above

J. R. Hallam
comlths attorney --
pro tem

Kenton Cir Ct
vs
John F. Fisk and
J. R. Hallam
D. Whitehouse

Gov Bramlette
Remit & hand to Senator Fisk --
T E B
2 Judgts
13th Jany/65
